reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scale-up of HIV-AIDS prevention, care and treatment services to 354 priority health zones targeting the general and key populations in the Democratic Republic of Congo

description.narrative: Congo (Democratic Republic) - HIV - Ministry of Health of the Democratic Republic of Congo - MOH. This program has the following goals: Controlling the HIV epidemic by 2025 in the DRC / Contrôle de l'épidémie du VIH à l'horizon 2025 en RDC. The objectives of this program are: Reduce new HIV infections by 75% (3,032) by 2023 / Réduire de 75% (3 032) les nouvelles infections à VIH d'ici 2023. Reduce HIV-related deaths among people living with HIV by 90% (828) by 2023 / Réduire de 90% (828) les décès liés au VIH chez les personnes vivant avec le VIH d'ici 2023. Put on ARV treatment 100% of co-infected patients (TB HIV +) during the period in the country / Mettre sous ARV 100% des patients coïnfectés (TB VIH+) durant la période dans le pays ;. Reduce HIV-related discrimination and stigma among PLHIV and key populations by 2023 / Réduire la discrimination et la stigmatisation liées au VIH chez les PVVIH et populations clés d'ici 2023. Management of the national response is efficient by 2023 / La gestion de la riposte nationale est performante d'ici 2023

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for COD-H-MOH
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
GP other-2: Number of new cases SVS having received PEP within 72 hours
Percentage of children (under 15) on ART among all children living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Percentage of adults (15 and above) on ART among all adults living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV newly initiated on ART who were screened for TB
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
M&E-other 1: Number and percentage of service providers in health facilities supervised
GP other-1: Number of new cases of sexual violence survivors (SVS)
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of facilities that receive supportive supervision – at least once per quarter
Percentage of health facilities providing diagnostic services with tracer items available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART, who have a suppressed viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of ART sites that had a stock-out of any antiretroviral drugs during the reporting period
TCS other-2: Percentage of children living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Impact indicator for COD-H-MOH
Percentage of people who inject drugs who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Percentage of people living with HIV
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
TB/HIV I-1: TB/HIV mortality rate, per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for COD-H-MOH
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percent of respondents who say they used a condom the last time they had sex with a non-marital, non-cohabiting partner, of those who have had sex with such a partner in the last 12 months
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who had more than one partner in the past 12 months who used a condom during their last sexual intercourse
Proportion of ever-married or partnered women aged 15-49 who experienced physical or sexual violence from a male intimate partner in the past 12 months
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who have had sexual intercourse with more than one partner in the past 12 months
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
